intro: Leptotaenia leibergii, commonly known as the Leiberg's spurge, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, succulent stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, it is adapted to thrive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
